thread.title: Legends of Tomorrow Season Finale Trailer and Arrow Clip
thread.title_full: Legends of Tomorrow Season Finale Trailer and Arrow Clip

author: CS
title: Legends of Tomorrow Season Finale Trailer and Arrow Clip
text:
SHARE Legends of Tomorrow season finale trailer and Arrow clip 
The CW has released both the trailer for next week’s DC’s Legends of Tomorrow season finale and a clip from tonight’s Arrow episode. The Legends of Tomorrow season finale airs on Tuesday, April 4. Titled “Aruba,” it’s described as follows: 
“As the Legends are about to take off for their next destination, a massive timequake rocks the ship. In order to try and fix what has happened, they are forced to break the one cardinal rule of time travel. But if they are able to destroy the spear, they will face the ultimate consequence. Victor Garber, Brandon Routh, Arthur Darvill, Caity Lotz, Dominic Purcell, Franz Drameh, Nick Zano and Maisie Richardson-Sellers.” 
Rob Seidenglanz directed the episode, written by Phil Klemmer & Marc Guggenheim. 
DC’s Legends of Tomorrow stars Arthur Darvill as Rip Hunter, Brandon Routh as Ray Palmer/The ATOM, Caity Lotz as Sara Lance/White Canary, Victor Garber and Franz Drameh as Professor Martin Stein & Jefferson “Jax” Jackson/Firestorm, Dominic Purcell as Mick Rory/Heat Wave, and Nick Zano as Dr. Nate Heywood/Steel. 
Tonight’s episode of Arrow is titled “Disbanded” and described as follows: 
“Diggle (David Ramsey) and Felicity (Emily Bett Rickards) are shocked by Oliver’s (Stephen Amell) decision to call on the Bratva to help take down Prometheus (Josh Segurra). Concerned the Bratva may overstep, Diggle has a hard conversation with Oliver about what happens if things go south. Meanwhile, Felicity learns something shocking at Helix.” 
J.J. Makaro directed the episode, which was written by Rebecca Bellotto. 
Arrow stars Stephen Amell as Oliver Queen, David Ramsey as John Diggle, Willa Holland as Thea Queen, Emily Bett Rickards as Felicity Smoak, John Barrowman as Malcom Merlyn, with Paul Blackthorne as Detective Lance. The series is executive produced by Greg Berlanti, Marc Guggenheim, Andrew Kreisberg and Sarah Schechter.
